doc.title: 90 Minutes: The World Cup of New York City
doc.plot: New York City is home to 2.8 million immigrants from 185 countries. In '90 Minutes' we follow a diverse group of New Yorkers from the 32 countries participating in the 2006 World Cup, as they experience the tournament in the city. We get a peak into their lives, dreams and passion for the game. How does the excitement of the month-long event enlighten their sense of identity and nationality? How does it bring them together and set them apart? What does it mean to be an immigrant in a city of immigrants? A portrait of the diversity of New York City told through the prism of the world's greatest sports event.
